cs211.SudoSolver

Class SudoPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • cs211.SudoSolver.SudoPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SudoPanel
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Runnable
    This class is used to set up the panel surrounding the board, the board itself and starts the thread for solving through buttons. The class basically contains the basis of the program, all of the visual side rather than any actual part of solving the sudoku really. The class does start the thread for solving but does not contain the algorithm for solving. This is essentially the GUI for the program.
    Author:
    Thomas Keogh - thk11
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • running

        public boolean running

    • Constructor Detail

      • SudoPanel

        public SudoPanel()
        The constructor builds the GUI including the board and buttons. Also adds actionlistener's to the button's as well as some minor pieces to do with how the board is set up and options regarding the size and position of the program as a whole.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Starts the thread called solving, this then starts to solve the loaded in grid.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Handles what happen's if a button is pressed, just call's correct methods.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • openChooser

        public java.io.File openChooser()
        This method launches a JFileChooser which in turn returns the file the user has chosen. Once the file has been chosen it is then handles by the load method inside SudoMethod.
        Returns:
        Returns the file to be opened into the grid.

      • makeBoard

        public void makeBoard()
        Handles the actual making of the 9x9 cell's, which in this case are my own Class called SudoCell. The method goes through two for loops creating the board and setting the value inside them, it then adds the board to the SudoPanel.

      • setCellValue

        public void setCellValue(int i,
                int j,
                java.lang.String string)
        This method handles setting the values within the grid. Continually called throughout SudoMethod to set the cell to the value passed in by several different methods.
        Parameters:
        i - Essentially the 'x' value of the cell.
        j - Essentially the 'y' value of the cell.
        string - The value that the cell will be set to.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the board to reflect the values that the cell's are actually set to, without this the board would never change.

      • setCandidatesForCell

        public void setCandidatesForCell(int i,
                        int j,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> list)
        This method sets a passed in array list as the candidate list of a cell thats co ordinates are also passed in. Specifically useful when editing candidate lists as without it candidate lists for cell's would never change.
        Parameters:
        i - Works out as the 'x' value for the cell.
        j - Works out as the 'y' value for the cell.
        list - The list to be set as the cell's candidate list.

      • getList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getList(int x,
                                            int y)
        Takes in a cell's co ordinates and returns the candidate list for the cell.
        Parameters:
        x - The 'x' value of the cell.
        y - The 'y' value of the cell.
        Returns:
        Returns the candidate list for specified cell.

      • getBoardValue

        public java.lang.String getBoardValue(int x,
                             int y)
        Returns the value stored within a cell, cell co ordinates passed in with method call. Specifically useful for checking/creating candidate lists.
        Parameters:
        x - The 'x' value of the cell
        y - The 'y' value of the cell
        Returns:
        Returns the value stored within the cell.

      • run

        public void run()
        Part of the thread, calls the solve method and and an update for the board. Method essentially starts the chain of methods that is the algorithm.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • suspend

        public void suspend()
        Sets the boolean running to false, thus stopped the thread if it is running.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Sets the boolean in the run method to true, allowing for solving to start.

      • getBool

        public boolean getBool()
